content: Find the volume of a cone if its base is 8 cm in diameter and its height is 12 cm.

To find the volume of a cone, you can use the formula:

\[ V = \frac{1}{3} \pi r^2 h \]

where \( V \) is the volume, \( r \) is the radius of the base, and \( h \) is the height of the cone.

First, find the radius of the base. Since the diameter is 8 cm, the radius \( r \) is half of that:

\[ r = \frac{8 \, \text{cm}}{2} = 4 \, \text{cm} \]

Now, substitute the radius and height into the formula:

\[ V = \frac{1}{3} \pi (4 \, \text{cm})^2 (12 \, \text{cm}) \]

\[ V = \frac{1}{3} \pi (16 \, \text{cm}^2) (12 \, \text{cm}) \]

\[ V = \frac{1}{3} \pi (192 \, \text{cm}^3) \]

\[ V = 64 \pi \, \text{cm}^3 \]

Using the approximation \(\pi \approx 3.14159\), the volume is approximately:

\[ V \approx 64 \times 3.14159 \, \text{cm}^3 \]

\[ V \approx 201.06 \, \text{cm}^3 \]

So, the volume of the cone is approximately \( 201.06 \, \text{cm}^3 \).
